data.title: Final Fantasy Chronology & Timeline of Media
data.meta_description: TIMELINE OF FINAL FANTASY MEDIA & RELATED GAMES "  Final Fantasy Chronology? Aren't there like a million games in that series? Aren't they all different worlds and characters? With unconnected story-lines? That would be impossible to timeline. " These are the things I can hear your tiny mind thinking. Well, yes they are and yes…
data.text:
TIMELINE OF FINAL FANTASY MEDIA & RELATED GAMES

” Final Fantasy Chronology? Aren’t there like a million games in that series? Aren’t they all different worlds and characters? With unconnected story-lines? That would be impossible to timeline. ”

These are the things I can hear your tiny mind thinking. Well, yes they are and yes it fucking was, my dear boy/girl/[insert pronoun here]. People have taken a good shot at it, GiantITP user DiscipleofBob for example did a superb job of trying to piece some of it together. Despite the fantastic work they did, I have listed the Final Fantasy media by date of release, within that, where titles have branched off and made their own series and sub-series all prequels and sequels within have been presented in the correct order in relation to their place within that specific series’ (i.e. Compilation of FFVII) canon.

THE ORIGINAL ERA

– Final Fantasy

(1987, Android/Arcade/BlackBerry OS/Windows Phone/Mobile phone/MSX/Nintendo 3DS/Nintendo DS/Game Boy Advance/Nintendo Entertainment System/GameCube/iOS/Ouya/PlayStation/PlayStation 2/PlayStation 3/PlayStation 4/PlayStation Portable/PlayStation Vita/Super Nintendo Entertainment System/Wii/Microsoft Windows/WonderSwan/Xbox 360/Xbox One)

– Final Fantasy II

(1988, Nintendo Entertainment System/WonderSwan Color/PlayStation/Game Boy Advance/NTT DoCoMo FOMA 901i/PlayStation Portable/PlayStation Network/iOS)

– Final Fantasy II: Soul of Rebirth

(2004, inc. in the compilation Final Fantasy I & II: Dawn of Souls, Game Boy Advance/Playstation Portable)

– Final Fantasy III

(1990, Nintendo Family Computer/Nintendo DS/iOS/Android/PlayStation Portable/Ouya/Windows Phone/Microsoft Windows)

THE FINAL FANTASY LEGEND/SaGa SERIES

– The Final Fantasy Legend

(1989,

– Final Fantasy Legend II

(1990, Game Boy/Nintendo DS)

– Final Fantasy Legend III

– Romancing SaGa

– Romancing SaGa 2

(1993, Super Famicom)

– SaGa Frontier

– SaGa Frontier 2

(1999, Playstation)

– Unlimited SaGa

(2002, Playstation 2)

– Emperor’s SaGa

(2012, GREE)

– The Legend of Legacy

(2015, Nintendo 3DS)

– Imperial SaGa

(2015, Microsoft Windows)

– SaGa: Scarlet Grace

(2016, PS Vita)

– Legend of Mana (1999, Playstation)

– Heroes of Mana

(2007, Nintendo DS)

– Final Fantasy Adventure

(1991, Game Boy/Mobile phone/iOS/Android/PlayStation Vita)

– Final Fantasy Mystic Quest

(1992, Super Nintendo Entertainment System/Wii Virtual Console)

– Sword of Mana

(2003, remake of Final Fantasy Adventure, Game Boy Advance

– Adventures of Mana

(2016, 2nd remake of Final Fantasy Adventure, Android/iOS/PS Vita)

– Secret of Mana

(1993, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, FOMA 903i/703i, iOS, Android)

– Secret of Evermore

(1995, although not officially a part of the Mana Series, it shares many similarities by way of themes and gameplay Super Nintendo Entertainment System)

FINAL FANTASY IV SERIES

– Final Fantasy IV

SNES/PlayStation/WonderSwan Color/Game Boy Advance/Nintendo DS/PlayStation Portable/iOS/Windows Phone/Microsoft Windows/Steam)

– Final Fantasy IV –Interlude-

(2011, inc. in the compilation Final Fantasy IV Complete Collection, Playstation Portable)

– Final Fantasy IV: The After Years

(2008, NTT Docomo FOMA 903i/WiiWare/PlayStation Portable/Playstation Network/iOS/Android/Microsoft Windows)

FINAL FANTASY V SERIES

– Final Fantasy V

(1992, Super Famicom/PlayStation/Game Boy Advance/iOS/Android/Microsoft Windows)

– Final Fantasy: Legend of the Crystals

(1994, 4-episode OVA, Rintaro/Madhouse Studios)

THE MACHINE ERA

– Figaro no Kekkon: Tales from Desert

(19??, Novel, Kaori Tanaka)

– Final Fantasy VI

(1994, Super Nintendo Entertainment System/PlayStation/Game Boy Advance/Android/iOS)

COMPILATION OF FINAL FANTASY VII

– Crisis Core -Final Fantasy VII-

(2007, Playstation Portable)

– Before Crisis -Final Fantasy VII-

(2004, NTT DoCoMo FOMA 900i Series, Softbank Yahoo! Mobile phones, AU EZweb phones)

– Final Fantasy VII

(1997, PlayStation, PC, PlayStation Network, iOS, Android)

– Final Fantasy VII Remake

(2016, Playstation 4)

– Hoshi Wo Moguru Otome (The Maiden Who Travels the Planet)

(2005, Novella, Benny Matsuyama)

– Last Order -Final Fantasy VII-

(2005, OVA, a not entirely faithful retrospective of the events of Crisis Core, Before Crisis and Final Fantasy VII, Morio Asaka)

– On the Way to a Smile

(2008, Short Story Collection, Kazushige Nojima)

– On the Way to a Smile: Episode Denzel

(2009, OVA, Ishihara Sinji)

– Final Fantasy VII Lateral Biography Turks -The Kids Are Alright-

(2011, Novel, Kazushige Nojima)

– Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children

(2005, Movie, Tetsuya Nomura/Takeshi Nozue/Sony Pictures Home Entertainment)

– Dirge of Cerberus -Final Fantasy VII-

(2006, Playstation 2)

– Dirge of Cerberus Lost Episode -Final Fantasy VII-

(2006, Amp’d Mobile/Verizon)

– Final Fantasy VII: Snowboarding

(2005, Mobile Phones)

– Final Fantasy VII G-Bike

(2014, iOS/Android)

– Final Fantasy Tactics

(1997, PlayStation/PlayStation Network)

– Final Fantasy Tactics: The War of the Lions

(2006, Playstation 2)

(2007, Nintendo DS)

(2013, iOS/Android)

– Chocobo World

(1999, Playstation/Playstation Network)

(1999, Released as part of the compilation Chocobo Collection, Playstation)

– Chocobo Stallion

(1999, Released as part of the compilation Chocobo Collection, Playstation)

(2010, Gree.jp/Facebook)

– Chocobo Panic

(2010, iOS)

THE GOLDEN ERA

– Final Fantasy VIII

(1999, PlayStation/PC/PlayStation Network/iOS/Android)

– Final Fantasy IX

(2000, PlayStation/PlayStation Network/Microsoft Windows/iOS/Android)

(2001, Hironobu Sakaguchi/Columbia Pictures)

FINAL FANTASY: UNLIMITED SERIES

– Final Fantasy: Unlimited

(2001-2002, Mahiro Maeda/Gonzo)

– Final Fantasy: Unlimited With U

(2002, Cellphone)

– Final Fantasy: Unlimited on PC Adventure – Labyrinth

(2003, PC)

FINAL FANTASY X SERIES

– Final Fantasy X

(2001, PlayStation 2/PlayStation 3/PlayStation 4/PlayStation Vita)

– Final Fantasy X: Eternal Calm

(2004, exclusively to Japan’s Final Fantasy X-2: International + Last Mission then to ROW in Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster, YouTube)

– Final Fantasy X-2

(2003, PlayStation 2/PlayStation 3/PlayStation 4/PlayStation Vita/Microsoft Windows)

– Final Fantasy X-2: Last Mission

(2004, exclusively to Japan’s Final Fantasy X-2: International + Last Mission then to ROW in Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster PlayStation 2/PlayStation 3/PlayStation Vita)

– Final Fantasy X-2.5 ~Eien no Daishō~

(2004, An utterly bizarre semi-erotic novel scorned by fans and literary critics alike, Kazushige Nojima)

– Final Fantasy X -Will-

(2004, An utterly bizarre audio drama sequel to the utterly bizarre semi-erotic novel scorned by fans and literary critics alike, Kazushige Nojima)

MMORPG SERIES

– Final Fantasy XI

(2002, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: Rise of the Zilart

(2003, Expansion to Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: Chains of Promathia

(2004, Expansion to Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: Treasures of Aht Urhgan

(2006, Expansion to Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: Wings of the Goddess

(2007, Expansion to Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: A Crystaline Prophecy – Ode to Life Bestowing

(2009, Add-on for Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: A Moogle Kupo d’Etat – Evil in Small Doses

(2009, Add-on for Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: A Shantotto Ascension – The Legend Torn, Her Empire Born

(2009, Add-on for Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: Vision of Abyssea

(2010, Add-on for Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: Scars of Abyssea

(2010, Add-on for Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: Heroes of Abyssea

(2010, Add-on for Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy XI: Seekers of Adoulin

(2013, Expansion to Final Fantasy XI, Playstation 2/Microsoft Windows/Xbox 360)

– Final Fantasy Grandmasters

(2015, iOS/Android)

– Final Fantasy XIV

(2010, Critically panned upon release, Square Enix had to announce a formal apology, pulled the game and rebuilt it from the ground up, Microsoft Windows)

– Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn

(2013, Complete Rebuild and Over-haul of Final Fantasy XIV, Microsoft Windows/Playstation 3/Playstation 4)

– Final Fantasy XIV: Heavensward

(2015, Expansion to Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn, Microsoft Windows/Mac/Playstation 3/Playstation 4)

CRYSTAL CHRONICLES SERIES
